author: fcying
body:
I always use `rg` to filter sth for `adb logcat`, it work fine in cmd, but it can't work with powershell.


##  Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS$ adb logcat | rg sth
output nothing.
```

use Select-String can be filter
```
PS$ adb logcat | Select-String sth
work fine.
```

use other command, it can be filter with rg.
```
PS$ dir | rg 2020
d-----         2020/11/3      9:54                test
```
use cmd.exe, it can be filter with rg.
```
cmd$ adb logcat | rg sth
work fine.
```


## Expected behavior

```none
display result 

```

## Actual behavior

```none
nothing
```

## Environment data
I test version 5.1(windows 10 version) and version 7.1(github last release), have same problem

What is a result of:
```powershell
$a = adb logcat
$a | rg ActivityManager

comments.author: fcying
comments.body:
```
PS>$a=adb logcat
PS>echo $a         
nothing
PS>$a | rg ActivityManager
nothing
PS>$a="ActivityManager"
PS>$a | rg ActivityManager
ActivityManager
```

I test `adb logcat -d`, it work fine.
```
PS>adb logcat -d | rg ActivityManager
work fine.
```

`adb logcat` is block and print log, `adb logcat -d` dump the log and then exit (don't block).
